Feb 28, 2022

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to a COVID-19
update.
CMA 2022 #20
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

2. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 21-97, regarding a report on creating a publicly accessible, list of violence prevention
programs that exist in the City and to place this list on the City's website.
CMA 2022 #21
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the reappointment
of Michael P. Gardner as a member of the Cambridge Retirement Board for a term of three years,
effective March 1, 2022. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY VICE MAYOR MALLON IN
COUNCIL FEBRUARY 28, 2022
CMA 2022 #22
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT BEXERCISED BY VICE MAYOR MALLON
Next: 3/7/2022 5:30 PM

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appointment
of Maxwell Solet as a new member of the Board of Trustee of the Cambridge Health Alliance for a
term to expire June 30, 2024. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY VICE MAYOR MALLON IN
COUNCIL FEBRUARY 28, 2022
CMA 2022 #23
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT BEXERCISED BY VICE MAYOR MALLON
Next: 3/7/2022 5:30 PM

PAGE 2

Feb 28, 2022

28, 2022
CMA 2022 #24
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT BEXERCISED BY VICE MAYOR MALLON
Next: 3/7/2022 5:30 PM

6. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the transfer of
$25,000 from the General Fund Electrical Department Salary and Wages Account to the General
Fund Electrical Travel and Training Account (Judgments and Damages) to cover medical services
and/or prescription reimbursement costs for personnel injured in performance of their duties.
CMA 2022 #25
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

Feb 28, 2022

9. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of $650,000 from Free Cash to the Public Investment Fund Department of Human Service Programs
Extraordinary Expenditures account to provide necessary repairs to the 3 swimming pools located at
the War Memorial Pool Facility.
CMA 2022 #28
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

14. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the City of
Cambridge retaining its AAA rating from the nation's three major credit rating agencies.
CMA 2022 #33
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

15. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the Climate
Resilience Zoning Task Force Report.
CMA 2022 #34
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT COMMITTEE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

16. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to a request for
approval of the special act that has been enacted by the Legislature and signed by the Governor,
entitled “Chapter 19 of the Acts of 2022, An Act Authorizing the City of Cambridge to Use Certain
Land for General Municipal Purposes and the Installation of Subsurface Geothermal Wells” at the
Father Callanan Playground and Fields in conjunction with the Tobin Montessori and Vassal Lane
Upper Schools Project.
CMA 2022 #35
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

17. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to a communication
from City Solicitor Nancy E. Glowa, relative to a further response to Awaiting Report Item Number
21-93 regarding a report on proposed amendments to the Municipal Code relative to recent charter
changes.
CMA 2022 #36
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 5

Feb 28, 2022

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. That Article 10.000 of the Zoning Ordinances of the City of Cambridge be amended to insert a
new section 10.600, titled “On-Site Fossil Fuel Infrastructure”
POR 2022 #17
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

2. That section 6.36 entitled, Schedule of Parking and Loading Requirements, of Article 6.000,
entitled OFF STREET PARKING AND LOADING REQUIREMENTS AND NIGHTTIME
CURFEW ON LARGE COMMERCIAL THROUGH TRUCKS, of the Zoning Ordinance of the
City of Cambridge be amended CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR IN
COUNCIL SIMMONS FEBRUARY 7, 2022
POR 2022 #19
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor McGovern
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE TRANSPORTATION AND PUBLIC UTILITIES
COMMITTEE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

3. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to direct staff from the Community
Development and Law Departments to examine the Zoning Ordinance and provide amendment
language for consideration by the City Council to remove all other references to parking
minimums, including in Articles 13.000, 14.000, 15.000, 16.000, 17.000, and 20.000. CHARTER
RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR SIMMONS IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 7, 2022
POR 2022 #24
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor McGovern
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE TRANSPORTATION AND PUBLIC UTILITIES
COMMITTEE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 6

Feb 28, 2022

ON THE TABLE

Feb 28, 2022

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. An application was received from MIT List Visual Arts Center requesting permission for 35
temporary banners across Ames Street Memorial Drive Main Street and Broadway announcing MIT
List, New Art on View, Contemporary Art from February 2022 through October 2022. CHARTER
RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR CARLONE IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 28, 2022
APP 2022 #5
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR CARLONE
Next: 3/7/2022 5:30 PM

2. An application was received from Dan Anderson, requesting permission for a curb cut at the premises
numbered 33 Webster Avenue said petition has received approval from Inspectional Services, Traffic,
Parking and Transportation, Historical Commission and Public Works. No response has been
received from the neighborhood association. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR
CARLONE IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 28, 2022
APP 2022 #6
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR CARLONE
Next: 3/7/2022 5:30 PM

3. An application was received from Kelley Brown, requesting permission for a curb cut at the premises
numbered 301 Vasser Street; said petition has received approval from Inspectional Services, Traffic,
Parking and Transportation, Historical Commission and Public Works. No response has been
received from the neighborhood association. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR
CARLONE IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 28, 2022
APP 2022 #7
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR CARLONE
Next: 3/7/2022 5:30 PM

4. An application was received from Dillon Lammers, requesting permission for a curb cut at the
premises numbered 1065 Cambridge Street; said petition has received approval from Inspectional
Services, Traffic, Parking and Transportation, Historical Commission and Public Works. No
response has been received from the neighborhood association. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY
COUNCILLOR CARLONE IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 28, 2022
APP 2022 #8
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR CARLONE
Next: 3/7/2022 5:30 PM

PAGE 8

Feb 28, 2022

Councillor Zondervan

Feb 28, 2022

V. RESOLUTIONS
1. Resolution on the death of Trudy Joan Cox.
Councillor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2022 #36
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

2. Thanks to Anne Shuhler and the entire Classic Graphx team for more than 35 years of exemplary
service to the people and businesses of Cambridge.
Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2022 #37
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor McGovern, Mayor
Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem, Councillor Zondervan

ABSENT:

Vice Mayor Mallon

3. Resolution on the death of Avram Goldberg.
Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2022 #38
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

4. That the City Council go on record thanking the TTT Mentor Program’s Mentees for participating in
the TTT Mentor Program’s 2021-2022 session.
Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2022 #39
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 41

Feb 28, 2022

5. City Council thanks to the Mentors for enriching the lives of their Mentees by participating in the
TTT Mentor Program’s 2021-2022 session.
Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2022 #40
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

6. City Council thanks to The Reverend Kathleen O’Keefe Reed for her years of extraordinary service to
the people of Cambridge, and in wishing her well in her retirement.

RES 2022 #41
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan and entire membership.
RES 2022 #42
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

8. That the City Council go on record thanking Izzy Maldonado and his family for over 41 years of
serving up some of the finest comfort food in Cambridge at Izzy’s Restaurant & Sub Shop, and in
wishing the family well as the beloved institution passes into memory.
Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2022 #43
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 42

Feb 28, 2022

9. Condolences to the family of Glenn M. Tegan for their tremendous loss.
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner and entire membership.
RES 2022 #44
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

10. Resolution on the death of Tommaso Sasso.
Councillor Toner and entire membership.
RES 2022 #45
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

PAGE 43

Feb 28, 2022

13. The Cambridge City Council was saddened to learn of the passing of George Berkowitz, Cambridge
native and founder of Legal Cash Market in Cambridge in 1950 and later, Legal Sea Foods, in Inman
Square in 1968.
Councillor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2022 #48
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 44

Feb 28, 2022

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the Executive Assistant to the City Council confer with the Dedication Committee to consider
the request for a street corner dedication in honor of Reuben Nathaniel Dottin, Jr. in the vicinity of
Hews Street and Western Avenue.
POR 2022 #25
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

2. Thanks to Ronald “R-Jay” Jones for his 50 years of service at the Cambridge Community Center, and
in declaring February 28, 2022 to be designated as Ronald “R-Jay” Jones Day in the City of
Cambridge.
POR 2022 #26
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

3. That the City Manager is requested to amend all existing Community Host Agreements previously
issued by the City by reducing the Impact Fee to 0.05% of Gross Revenue and to refrain from placing
this burden upon any future HCAs that may yet be issued. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY
COUNCILLOR ZONDERVAN IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 28, 2022
POR 2022 #27
Councillor Simmons, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Toner, Councillor Azeem
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR ZONDERVAN
Next: 3/7/2022 5:30 PM

PAGE 45

Feb 28, 2022

4. That the Mayor is requested to schedule a Special Meeting of the City Council and invite the Mayor
of Somerville, Somerville City Councillors, the Cambridge Police Department, the Somerville Police
Department, and others to discuss how to work together to address the gun activity taking place
between our youth in our communities.
POR 2022 #28
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

5. That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Economic Development division and other
appropriate departments with the intention of conducting a study to collect relevant economic data
relating to business impacts from bike lane installations, positive or negative, which will help inform
future installations of bike lanes along commercial corridors
POR 2022 #29
Councillor McGovern, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

6. That the Executive Assistant to the City Council is requested to confer with the Dedication
Committee to consider this request for a suitable dedication in honor of Janet Axelrod in the vicinity
of Broadway and Trowbridge Street.
POR 2022 #30
Vice Mayor Mallon, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Nolan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

Feb 28, 2022

7. That a City Manager Search ad-hoc committee of the Cambridge City Council be formed for the
purpose of reviewing and selecting self-nominated residents and stakeholders to be on the candidate
preliminary screening committee.
POR 2022 #31
Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:

Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

8. That the Cambridge City Council calls for the Federal Government to reverse Title 42 and
immediately halt the deportation of Haitian migrants, thereby allowing them to seek due process
through our legal system to make claims for legal status.
POR 2022 #32
Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

9. That the Executive Assistant to the City Council confer with the Dedication Committee to consider
the request from Councillor Azeem for a suitable location to dedicate a street corner in honor of Dr.
Andre Gabor Borda.
POR 2022 #33
Councillor Azeem
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon,
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem,
Councillor Zondervan

10. That the City Manager is requested to work with DCR to pilot an expansion of Memorial Drive
closures along any segments east of Western Avenue that could be used as parkland. CHARTER

RESULT:
